content: 2023 my measurements are in metric with approximate equivalent given in imperial don t be too fussed i m sure your dog won t be bothered please read the entire pattern prior to commencing k2 row 2 k2 purl to last 2 sts k2 row 3 change to c2 and work as row 1 row 4 knit all stitches repeat row 1 to 4 until your work measures 40cm 16 across cast-on edge as shown the stitch count will increase by 8 on each full pattern repeat if unsure that the measurement will suit your dog carefully slip the stitches onto waste yarn and try it on at this stage it should be snug but definitely not tight continue row 1 to 4 if you require once you have reached a size that suits cut off c1 leaving a 15cm 6 tail for weaving in 2 ginnie s winter bandana ©sandra levey 15 january 2023 continue in c2 only row 1 k1 kfb knit to one stitch before marker kfb sm kfb knit to last 3 sts kfb k2 row 2 knit all stitches repeat these two row for 2 5-3cm 1 -1 25 you will require approximately 4 metres 4 yards of yarn for binding off on a rs row a little more loosely than you might otherwise using a larger needle if necessary weave in all ends leaving the bind off tail until later and block to a width of 50cmw x 25cmh 20 w x 10 h after drying overlap the two upper ends of the triangle and sew a few stitches using the bind- off tail to hold in place sew in that end and trim variations to consider use a single colour use your favourite sports team colours use two plain colours work from both ends of a gradient yarn use a gradual striping yarn for c1 so no abrupt colour changes appear in the middle of a row use a third colour to complete the garter border use a third/fourth colour for the bind-off use your leftover yarn for a crazy multicoloured bandana your dog won t care use fingering weight yarn held doubled my favourite use of leftover sock yarn use lace weight yarn held trebled or quadrupled a very tall dog might require the length but not as much width so consider working the increases in
